0.4 grams/liter
0.5 grams/liter
answer: 0.5 grams/liter

question: In the first three years of having a drivers' license, the level of alcohol in the blood should not exceed:
options: 0 grams/liter
0.3 grams/liter
0.5 grams/liter
answer: 0 grams/liter

question: It is strictly prohibited for drivers to:
options: Use any communication devices
Use one hand to drive and the other to answer the phone
Use both hands to drive, and answer the call using Bluetooth technology
answer: Use any communication devices

question: Where there is no speed limit signs, the upper speed limit on the freeway is:
options: 80 km/hour
100 km/hour
120 km/hour
answer: 100 km/hour

question: Where there is no speed limit signs, the upper speed limit outside populated areas is:
options: 50 km/hour
60 km/hour
70 km/hour
answer: 70 km/hour

question: Where there is no speed limit signs, the upper speed limit inside populated areas is:
options: 40 km/hour
50 km/hour
60 km/hour
answer: 50 km/hour

question: You can reverse on the freeway if the exit is near, provided you do not go faster than:
options: 10 meters
20 meters
You cannot reverse at all
answer: You cannot reverse at all

question: On a normal road, you place the warning triangle in front or behind the vehicle, depending on the direction of traffic, at the following distance from the vehicle:
options: 20 meters
30 meters
40 meters
answer: 30 meters

question: On the freeway, you place the warning triangle in front or behind the vehicle, depending on the direction of traffic, at the following distance from the vehicle:
options: 50 meters
60 meters
70 meters
answer: 50 meters

question: Pedestrians should use pavements and pedestrian crossings and paths when they are at a distance of:
options: 130 meters
150 meters
170 meters
answer: 150 meters

question: When the driver causes an accident, and even if damages are material damages only:
options: The driver has the right to flee the scene and avoid responsibility
The driver should carry on driving
The driver should stop and take care of the victim
answer: The driver should stop and take care of the victim

question: If the brake lights are down:
options: The car may be impounded
This is a Class 2 violation
All of the above
answer: All of the above

question: The shelf life of tyres does not exceed:
options: 4 years from manufacturing date or 1.6 mm thread thickness, whichever comes first
5 years from manufacturing date or 1.6 mm thread thickness, whichever comes last
6 years from manufacturing date or 1.6 mm thread thickness, whichever comes first
answer: 6 years from manufacturing date or 1.6 mm thread thickness, whichever comes first

question: When the traffic light is green, but traffic is congested, road users should:
options: Move slowly so as not to obstruct traffic
Cross the green light quickly
Refrain from crossing the green light if it would obstruct traffic
answer: Refrain from crossing the green light if it would obstruct traffic

question: A power of attorney to sell a vehicle is valid for not more than:
options: One month
Three months
Two months
answer: Two months

question: A broken line on the road means:
options: You can travel on the line
You cannot cross the line
You can cross the line
answer: You can cross the line

question: Vehicles of all types cannot be fitted in the front with lights other than:
options: Blue or yellow
White or blue
White or yellow
answer: White or yellow

question: If the road is divided into two lanes with a yellow line, the driver should, in normal traffic situation:
options: Use the middle lane
Use the left lane
Use the right lane
answer: Use the right lane

options: The driver can change lane if the solid line is to the right, and cannot change lane if the broken line is to the right
The driver cannot change lane if the solid or broken line is to the right
The driver can change lane if the broken line is to the right, and cannot change lane if the solid line is to the right

question: The driver should give the right of way to:
options: Vehicles
Trucks
Pedestrians
answer: Pedestrians

question: In steep descents, the right of way goes to:
options: It depends on the road itself
Vehicles moving upwards
Vehicles moving downwards
answer: Vehicles moving upwards

question: Inside cities, you should always keep a safe distance of:
options: 1 second
2 meters
2 seconds
answer: 2 seconds

question: In entering a roundabout, the right of way is for:
options: The vehicle on the left
The vehicle on the right
The vehicle that is already in the roundabout
answer: The vehicle that is already in the roundabout

question: Overtaking is not allowed in:
options: Multiple lane tunnels
Double lane tunnels
Single lane tunnels
answer: Single lane tunnels

question: In case of road works, the driver should:
options: Turn on his vehicle lights
Drive fast
Reduce speed
answer: Reduce speed

question: Children below the age of five should be seated:
options: In their parents laps
In the back seats
In child seats
answer: In child seats

question: When vehicles are still approaching an intersection, the right of way is always for the driver coming from:
options: Inside the intersection
The left
The right

options: 65 CM
70 CM
75 CM

options: 45 CM
60 CM
50 CM
answer: 50 CM

question: Drivers are prohibited to obstruct traffic by:
options: Stopping slowly
Travelling below the lower speed limit
Stopping suddenly without a valid reason to do so
answer: Stopping suddenly without a valid reason to do so

question: When you meet head-on with another vehicle on a two-way road, who should reverse?
options: Heavy vehicles for a single vehicle
A group of vehicles for a single vehicle
A single vehicle for a group of vehicles
answer: A single vehicle for a group of vehicles

question: Who has the right of way on a three forked road?
options: The driver who proceeds cautiously
The driver on the right side
The driver who is on the straight lane
answer: The driver who is on the straight lane

question: When you see on the freeway a sign that indicates that there is a road diversion or that the lane you are on will lead you to another direction, all drivers wishing to exist the lane should
options: Swerve very quickly to the lane that will take them to the desired direction to avoid obstructing traffic
Swerve gradually left or right to the lane that will take them to the desired direction
Swerve immediately left or right to the lane that will take them to the desired direction to avoid obstructing traffic

question: Seat belts should be fastened by passengers sitting:
options: In the front and back seats when on the highway, in all types of vehicles
In the front seats, in all types of vehicles
In the front and back seats, in all types of vehicles and on all roads
answer: In the front and back seats, in all types of vehicles and on all roads

question: When the traffic policeman lifts his hand vertically, it means:
options: You have to slow down
Traffic ahead has come to a halt
"Careful and stop" to all road users
answer: "Careful and stop" to all road users

question: When the traffic policeman's hands are stretched horizontally, it means:
options: "Slow down"  -- for all road users coming from directions that cross with the strecthed hands directions
"Make way" -- for all road users coming from directions that cross with the strecthed hands directions
"Stop" -- for all road users coming from directions that cross with the strecthed hands directions
answer: "Stop" -- for all road users coming from directions that cross with the strecthed hands directions

question: Every vehicle should be fitted with:
options: A registration plate at the back side of the vehicle
Two registration plates with the vehicle number, at front or back side of the vehicles
Two registration plates with the vehicle number, at the front and back sides of the vehicles
answer: Two registration plates with the vehicle number, at the front and back sides of the vehicles

question: Up until the age of 50, the driver should renew his driving license every:
options: 20 years
5 years
10 years
answer: 10 years

question: Warning sounds can be used only:
options: To alert other drivers  that they should move quickly
To escape heavy traffic
To alarm other road users so as to avoid accidents
answer: To alarm other road users so as to avoid accidents

question: In case there is no sign that indicates which side of the vehicle should be used to step out of the vehicle

The passenger should step in and out of the vehicle from the door that is on the same side of traffic
The passenger should step in and out of the vehicle from the door that is on the other side of traffic
answer: The passenger should step in and out of the vehicle from the door that is on the other side of traffic

question: When the driver waives his hand up and down, it means:
options: Car breakdown
Direction to the left
Slow down and stop
answer: Slow down and stop

question: When the driver streches his hand horizontally, it means the driver is:
options: Reversing
Slowing down
Turning left
answer: Turning left

question: When the driver streches his hand vertically, it means:
options: Stop
Direction to the left
Direction to the right
answer: Direction to the right

question: Vehicles turning right can cross a red light provided:
options: They do it quickly
Vehicles turning right cannot cross a red light
They stop at the traffic light, make sure they can cross without putting pedestrians and vehicles at risk
answer: They stop at the traffic light, make sure they can cross without putting pedestrians and vehicles at risk

question: When the road is marked with solid lines:
options: The driver can change lanes, but has to do it quickly
The driver can change lanes, provided he makes sure there is enough gap in the other lane
The driver cannot change lanes
answer: The driver cannot change lanes

question: Children under ____ cannot sit in the front seat:
options: 10 years
12 years
8 years
answer: 10 years

Cause road markings to fade away
Cause accidents, and clog water drainage system
answer: Cause accidents, and clog water drainage system

Yellow lines are used for one-way roads whereas white lines are used for two-way streets
White lines demarcate lanes that go in the same direction, yellow lines are demarcate lanes that go in opposite directions

question: Drivers cannot stop or park within ____ from intersections or traffic lights:
options: 50 meters
30 meters
25 meters

options: Transport expired bottles or cans o alcohol
Transport in their vehicles bottles or cans of alcohol that have the manufacturer seal
Transport in their vehicles unsealed bottles or cans of alcohol
answer: Transport in their vehicles unsealed bottles or cans of alcohol

question: Drivers should stop and park:
options: On white pedestrian crossing stripes
After white crossing stripes
Before white crossing stripes

question: Drivers are prohibited to:
options: Cross broken white lines
Travel between white lines
Travel on white lines
answer: Travel on white lines

question: The driver and passengers should fasten their seat belt:
options: Before turning on the car engine
Prior to setting off
After a minute from setting off
answer: Before turning on the car engine

options: To rest the head during the car trip
To protect the neck in a rear end collision
To be used as a pillow for sleeping during long trips

options: Having an abundance in energy
Being sleepy and tired
Driving inside the city
answer: Being sleepy and tired

Negative way
Both positive and negative way
answer: Negative way

Refrain from driving until the side effects of alcohol have disappeared
Not to be bothered

options: Delightful
Not dangerous
Dangerous
answer: Dangerous

Put the gear on neutral, turn off the engine and stop on the side of the road

Reduce your speed gradually and pull to the side of the road

options: A bit earlier than usual
A bit later than usual
With good spirits
answer: A bit earlier than usual

options: Make sure he has enough time on his hands
Look around and under the vehicle
Fasten the seatbelt
answer: Look around and under the vehicle

options: 45 seconds
30 seconds
4 to 8 seconds
answer: 4 to 8 seconds

The right-side mirror only
All the mirrors, especially the right-side mirror and blind spots
answer: All the mirrors, especially the right-side mirror and blind spots

options: Pedestrians, and children, appearing suddenly from between these parked vehicles
Trash being thrown from them towards the passing vehicles
Loud sounds from the radios of these vehicles
answer: Pedestrians, and children, appearing suddenly from between these parked vehicles

options: The alarm that would go off as the drivers cross next to these vehicles
The oppening of a car trunk
The fact that any of these parked vehicles could take off and join traffic at any time
answer: The fact that any of these parked vehicles could take off and join traffic at any time

question: As a cautious driver, you should:
options: Take the right of way by force as it is your right
Yield the right of way to prevent road collisions
Never yield your right of way
answer: Yield the right of way to prevent road collisions

question: While driving and prior to hitting your brakes, you should first look:
options: In the mirrors, namely the rear-view mirror
To your right
To your left
answer: In the mirrors, namely the rear-view mirror

question: When strong braking is applied, ABS in modern vehicles:
options: Should not make noise or cause the brake pedal to pulsate
Would normally make noise and cause the brake pedal to pulsate
Would normally cause the brake pedal to pulsate
answer: Would normally make noise and cause the brake pedal to pulsate

options: Preventing brakes from locking-up and allows the driver to maintain steering control of the vehicle
Preventing brakes locking-up only
Not preventing brakes locking-up and not helping the driver maintain steering control of the vehicle
answer: Preventing brakes from locking-up and allows the driver to maintain steering control of the vehicle

Increase your speed
answer: Get your foot off the accelerator (don't press on the brakes) and steer your vehicle in the same direction

question: If you leave a safe distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front, you will be able to:
options: Avoid a collision with that vehicle should it make a sudden stoop
Enjoy the view surrounding you
Read the plate number of that vehicle
answer: Avoid a collision with that vehicle should it make a sudden stoop

Sound your horn
Make sure the road is empty then take off

options: Provide right of way
Stop
Fasten the seatbelt

question: The seat belt must be used:
options: By all passengers
By front-seat passengers only
Not absolutely necessary
answer: By all passengers

With both hands

The authorized number of passengers
Are not entitled to transport passengers

Air pipes only are connected properly
Electric lines only are connected properly
